intro: Eranthemum faecundum, commonly known as the golden bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Eranthemum faecundum thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
